task_description: Facing the building to your South-West (approx. 241°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to estimate the height of the building in front of me, so I will first look up to see its full extent from the ground to the very top.
I have seen the top of the building; now I need to look down to see its base to get a sense of the full vertical extent.

Having viewed the building from top to bottom, I can see it has about 6-7 stories, and assuming a standard floor height of 3.5 meters plus a taller ground floor, I estimate the total height to be around 25 meters.
